questions.text: All of the following are direct causes of maternal mortality except:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Heart disease Maternal Death – Death of a woman while pregnant or within 42 days of termination of pregnancy, irrespective of the duration and site of pregnancy, from any cause related to or aggravated by the pregnancy or its management but not from an accident or incidental causes is called maternal death. So heart disease is an indirect cause of maternal death, not a direct cause.

Highyeild:

Maternal Mortality Ratio (MMR) Maternal Mortality Rate No of maternal deaths per 100,000 live births In India: MMR is 212 per 100,000 live births Note: The MMR is expressed in per lac live births No of maternal deaths divided by the number of women in reproductive age (15-49). It is expressed per 100,000 women of reproductive age per year India it is 120 as compared to 0.5 in us

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:A. APH is direct cause of maternal death Option:B. PPH is direct cause of maternal death Option:D. Eclampsia is direct cause of maternal death

questions.text: Comprehensive emergency obstetric care does not include:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Hysterectomy Hysterectomy is not included in Comprehensive emergency obstetric care . It includes Manual removal of placenta ,Hysterectomy,Blood transfusion,Cesarean section etc .

Highyeild:

Setting standards of emergency obstetrics and newborn care : Basic emergency obstetric and newborn care provided in health centers, large or small include the facilities for: Administration of antibiotics, oxytocics and anticonvulsants. Manual removal of the placenta . Removal of retained products following miscarriage or abortion. Assisted vaginal delivery preferably with vacuum extractor. Comprehensive emergency obstetric and newborn car e:IT typically delivered in district hospital, includes all basic functions above, plus cesarean section , safe blood transfusion and care to sick and low birth weigh t newborns including resuscitation. It is recommended that for every 5,00,000 people there should be 4 facilities offering comprehensive essential obstetric care.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:A . Manual removal of placenta is included in Comprehensive emergency obstetric and newborn care . Option:C. Blood transfusion is included in Comprehensive emergency obstetric and newborn care . Option:D. Cesarean section is included in Comprehensive emergency obstetric and newborn care .

questions.text: A 26-Year-old woman complains of infertility for 2 years. She has a low libido, and has put on a lot of weight. She also noted sparse pubic hairs and her breast were found to be discharging on examination. What is most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Hypopituitarism The patient most likely suffers from Sheehan syndrome. Sheehan's syndrome, also known as postpartum pituitary gland necrosis, is hypopituitarism caused by ischemic necrosis due to blood loss. Sheehan's syndrome causes the pituitary gland to not produce enough pituitary hormones (hypopituitarism).Which leads to symptoms like failue to lactate ,absent menstruation .,Infertility , loss of libido etc .

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. Incorrect Hyperthyroidism (overactive thyroid) occurs when your thyroid gland produces too much of the hormone thyroxine.Hyperthyroidism can accelerate your body's metabolism, causing unintentional weight loss and a rapid or irregular heartbeat. Option: B. Incorrect The symptoms of genital TB are: irregular menstrual cycle pelvic pain vaginal discharge that is stained with blood or which is persistent, heavy bleeding after intercourse infertility Option: D. Incorrect Patients with adenomyosis complain of secondary dysmenorrhea and menorrhagia .The classical examination finding includes a diffusely, symmetrically enlarged uterus with no adnexal tenderness. More common is multiparous women over 35 years of age.

questions.text: A pregnant mother is treated with oral anticoagulant. The likely congenital malformation that may result in the fetus is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Chondrodysplasia punctata Chondrodysplasia punctata likely congenital malformation that may occur if a pregnant women is taking warfarin during first trimester .

Highyeild:

Warfarin is an anticoagulant drug. Mechanism of Action : Interferes with the synthesis of the vitamin K dependent factors like II, VII, IX and X. Side effects: Hemorrhage It leads to: – Contradi’s syndrome : skeletal and facial anomalies in the fetus – Chondrodysplasia punctata in the fetus. Miscarriage, IUGR and stillbirths accentuates neonatal hypothrombinemia.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:A. Long bones limb defect is incorrect . Option:B. Cranial malformation is incorrect . Option:C. Cardiovascular malformation is incorrect .

questions.text: A woman is currently being treated for acne with oral retinoids and finds herself pregnant in the first trimester. What is her chance of miscarrying?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

10–15% The incidence of spontaneous miscarriage is considered to be 20–40%. The overall risks of fetal malformations in live born infants exposed to isotretinoin in utero are estimated to be 20–35%.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A ,B & D : are incorrect options .

questions.text: Changes in the respiratory system in pregnancy:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Residual volume is decreased Residual volume t he volume of air remaining in the lungs after maximum forceful expiration.

Highyeild:

Changes in respiratory system during pregnancy: With the enlargement of the uterus, especially in the later months, there is elevation of the diaphragm by 4 cm . Total lung capacity is reduced by 5% due to this elevation. Breathing becomes diaphragmatic. Total pulmonary resistanc e is reduced due to progesterone effect . The subcostal angle increases from 68° to 103°, the transverse diameter of the chest expands by 2 cm and the chest circumference increases by 5–7 cm. A state of hyperventilation occurs during pregnancy leading to increase in tidal volume and therefore respiratory minute volume by 40%.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:A. Vital capacity is increased is incorrect option .It remains unchanged Option:B. Subcostal angle remains unchanged is incorrect option .it increases Option:C. Tidal volume remains unaltered is incorrect option .it increases .

questions.text: In modern obstetrics what is the preferred investigation used for monitoring of fetus in a Rh-ve sensitized mother?
questions.correct_answer: C. MCA Doppler peak systolic velocity
questions.explanation:
Solution:

MCA Doppler peak systolic velocity MCA Doppler peak systolic velocity is the preferred investigation used for monitoring of fetus in a Rh-ve sensitized mother.

Highyeild:

MCA DOPPLER : It is enhanced due to increased cardiac output a nd decreased viscosity . It has also replaced amniocentesis as the preferred test for anemia detection. The critical level is that level below which no death due to fetal hemolytic disease has occurred within 1 week of delivery: The critical titer is taken as 10 IU/L in India and in Europe and UK as 15 IU/L. Serum antibody titers are done in these women every 4 weeks till 28 weeks a nd then every 2 weeks until the titers are found to be at or above the critical level (1:16) .If titres are above critical level , there is no further use of antibody titer and the pregnancy is further monitored by middle cerebral artery peak systolic velocity (MCA-PSV) or amniotic fluid bilirubin concentration.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. A biophysical profile (BPP) test measures the health of your baby (fetus) during pregnancy. A BPP test may include a nonstress test with electronic fetal heart monitoring and a fetal ultrasound. The BPP measures your baby's heart rate, muscle tone, movement, breathing, and the amount of amniotic fluid around your baby. Option: B. Amniocentesis is a procedure in which amniotic fluid is removed from the uterus for testing or treatment. It should be avoided because during the amniocentesis, blood cells from the mother and fetus can mix. This can lead to Rh sensitization and breaking down of fetal red blood cells. Option: D. The non-invasive test, using a blood sample of the pregnant woman, is as reliable as the conventional test using a blood sample of the newborn. But not preferred in modern obstetrics.

questions.text: Pregnant women in 1st trimester was given spiramycin for cervical lymphadenopathy for which she was non compliant. Baby was born with hydrocephalus infection . The organism responsible was :
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Toxoplasma In the question- patient had mild cervical lymphadenopathy for which she was prescribed spiramycin. But the patient was noncompliant and the baby was born with hydrocephalous and intracranial calcification , which are manifestations of congenital toxoplasmosis.

Highyeild:

TOXOPLASMOSIS Caused by T. gondii which is an obligate intracellular protozoan parasite. Cat is the definitive host. Maternal infection is acquired by eating under cooked meat. Primary infection causes immunity which is life-long and usually prevents reinfection, i.e. if a female has toxoplasma IgG antibody before pregnancy, there is no risk for a congenitally infected fetus. Congenital Transmission: The risk of transmission increases with the period of gestation, i.e. maximum chances of infection are during 3rd trimester. Severity of infection decreases with gestational age, i.e. most in the first trimester. most severe infection occurs when toxoplasma is transmitted. In acute maternal toxoplasma infection patients are usually asymptomatic (in 80-90% cases). Some patients may present with posterior cervical lymphadenopathy (lymph s are nontender, discrete and firm), fever, fatigue, lassitude and maculopapular rash. DOC for Toxoplasma during pregnancy is spiramycin (1g every 8 hours). Spiramycin reduces the risk of congenital infection during pregnancy. If fetal infection is confirmed 3 weeks of spiramycin is alternated with 3 weeks of pyrimethamine sulfonamide combination, and continued till delivery. This is because spiramycin can prevent fetal infection but cannot treat the infection if it is present. Triad of congenital toxoplasmosis Routine maternal screening for Toxoplasma is not done. If maternal infection is confirmed, by serology and avidity testing, to confirm fetal infection following tests are done. Gold standard: Isolation of toxoplasma in the amniotic fluid by PCR. Ultrasonography to detect fetal anomalies. If the fetus is infected and hydrocephalus is resent, counseling for termination is to be done. me Presence of IgM antibody in the neonate indicates congenital infection. Treatment with pyrimethamine should be continued in these babies till 1 year of age.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. HSV RECREATE Option: B. Treponema Pallidum -CONGENITAL SYPHILIS .RECREATE FOLLOWING Confused:- Hutchinson pupils: Seen in Raised ICP. Hutchinson Sign : Seen in facial herpes Looster. Involvement of TIP of Nose. Option: D. CMV RECREATE Show Presence of Periventricular calcification on NCCT . Ventriculomegaly Microcephaly IUGR Petechial Rash Jaundice Hepatosplenomegaly Deafness Chorioretinitis

Bakri’s Balloon The Bakri balloon is used for temporary control or reduction of postpartum hemorrhage when conservative management of uterine bleeding is warranted.

questions.text: What particular parameter is being used to measure the gestational age?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Crown-Rump length Crown-Rump length is corect option according to image shown . Sonographic measurement of the crown-rump length (CRL) is the most accurate method to establish or confirm gestational age.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. Incorrect Femur length measures the longest bone in the body and reflects the longitudinal growth of the fetus. Femur Length is the most accurate parameter used for sonographic estimation of gestational age in the third trimester Option: C. Incorrect Biparietal diameter is the diameter between the 2 sides of the head. It is the most accurate parameter used for sonographic estimation of gestational age in the second trimester. Option: D. Incorrect Abdominal circumference is measured in the transverse plane at the fetal liver, with the umbilical portion of the left portal vein in the center of the abdomen.

Extraedge:

The CRL is measured in the midsagittal plane with the embryo or fetus in a neutral, nonflexed positio n so that its length can be measured in a straight line. Measurement of crown rump length (CRL) detected CRL in cm + 6.5 = weeks of pregnancy at 7 weeks it is 10 mm; at 10 weeks it is 34 mm . Best parameters for estimation of fetal age ● 1st trimester ● 2nd trimester ● 3rd trimester ● Overall Crown Rump length (CRL) Biparietal diameter (BPD) Femur length Crown rump length

questions.text: Which layer of muscles takes place in halting the bleeding after delivery (Living Ligature)?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Intermediate Criss-Cross Fibers Intermediate Crisscross Fibers is the middle layer. The myocytes in this layer takes the arrangement in the form of 8 . (Pinnard’s living ligature ) The blood vessels run in between this Criss cross arrangement. This arrangement is so crucial in halting the bleeding after the delivery. The mechanism is constriction of blood vessels by this crisscross arrangement of myocytes after delivery.

Highyeild:

Mechanism of control of bleeding: After placental separation, innumerable torn sinuses which have free circulation of blood from uterine and ovarian vessels have to be obliterated. The, occlusion is affected by complete retraction whereby the arterioles, as they pass tortuously through the interlacing intermediate layer of the myometrium, are literally clamped . It (living ligature) is the principal mechanism of hemostasis. However, thrombosis occurs to occlude the torn sinuses, a phenomenon, which is facilitated by hypercoagulable state of pregnancy. Apposition of the walls of the uterus following expulsion of the placenta (myotamponade) also contributes to minimize blood loss. Blood vessels: Running through the interlacing muscle fibers; literally clamped due to effective retraction of the uterine muscles

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:A. Outer Longitudinal Fibers is incorrect options Option:B. Inner Circular Sphincter Fibers is incorrect options Option:D. All of the above is incorrect options

questions.text: Which of the following is normally present in urine of a pregnant woman in 3rd trimester:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Glucose Glycosuria during pregnancy is normally seen in 5-50% cases Reason = Increase in GFR + impaired tubular reabsorptive capacity for filtered glucose.Mostly seen in mid pregnancy. For detecting glycosuria second fasting morning sample is collected Fasting glycosuria , if present is ominous If glycosuria is seen on one occasion before 20 weeks or on 2 on more occasions thereafter or if glycosuria is present in a pregnant female who has a positive family H/O diabetes or has previously given birth to a macrosomic baby Glucose tolerance test should be done. Management – Glycosuria does not require any treatment and it disappears after delivery.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Options: B, C & D are incorrect options .
